algorithms.test_generation: LLM-based structured generation with deterministic ID assignment

business_intent: To automate the generation of a Requirement Traceability Matrix for improved test coverage transparency and compliance with ISO audit requirements.

ticket_details.description:
To support ISO audit requirements and improve test coverage transparency, the AI Testing Agent must automatically generate a Requirement Traceability Matrix (RTM) for each test plan.
The RTM will prov...
ticket_details.summary: Add Requirement Traceability Matrix (RTM) Generation for Test Plans

summary: Test plan includes multiple tests for RTM generation, covering happy paths and negative scenarios, with no gaps detected.

steps: Navigate to the application
Trigger the action described in the requirement
Observe the system response and verify it matches the expected outcome
api_tests.title: Happy Path: [3]. Requirement ID

steps: Navigate to the application

api_tests.expected_result: System automatically performs: [7]. Every requirement appears exactly once in the RTM.
steps: Create a test plan containing at least one requirement and one test case.
Allow the system to complete test plan generation.
Verify that a Requirement Traceability Matrix (RTM) is generated automatically.
Verify the RTM contains exactly one entry per requirement.
Verify each RTM entry includes requirement ID, description, associated test case IDs, and coverage status.
api_tests.title: System-level happy path: [7]. Every requirement appears exactly once in the RTM.

api_tests.expected_result: System automatically performs: [8]. The RTM is derived directly from the test plan

api_tests.title: System-level happy path: [8]. The RTM is derived directly from the test plan

api_tests.expected_result: System automatically performs: [10]. RTM generation does not block test plan creation.
steps: Create a test plan containing at least one requirement and one test case.
Allow the system to complete test plan generation.
Verify that a Requirement Traceability Matrix (RTM) is generated automatically.
Verify the RTM contains exactly one entry per requirement.
Verify that RTM generation does not block or delay test plan creation.
api_tests.title: System-level happy path: [10]. RTM generation does not block test plan creation.

data_validation_tests.expected_result: Invalid input is rejected with appropriate error
steps: Navigate to the application
Locate and interact with the input mentioned in the requirement
Observe the system response and verify it matches the expected outcome
data_validation_tests.title: Inferred data validation test for ATA-36-REQ-008-002

ui_tests.expected_result: The RTM is generated successfully after the test plan is created.
steps: Create a new test plan in the system.
Observe that the system generates an RTM automatically after the test plan is created.
Verify that the RTM is displayed or accessible in the system.
ui_tests.title: Happy path: RTM generation after test plan creation

ui_tests.expected_result: The RTM entries contain all required fields and each requirement appears exactly once.
steps: Create a new test plan in the system.
Generate the RTM for the created test plan.
Verify that each entry in the RTM includes the Requirement ID, Requirement description, Associated test case ID(s), and Coverage status.
Verify that every requirement appears exactly once in the RTM.
ui_tests.title: Happy path: RTM entry includes required fields

ui_tests.expected_result: The test plan is created successfully without blocking due to RTM generation.
steps: Attempt to create a new test plan in the system.
Observe that the RTM generation occurs without any errors or blocks.
Verify that the test plan is created successfully.
ui_tests.title: Happy path: RTM generation does not block test plan creation

ui_tests.expected_result: The system displays an error message indicating that RTM generation requires a test plan.
steps: Attempt to generate an RTM without creating a test plan first.
Observe the system's response to the attempt.
Verify that an appropriate error message is displayed indicating that a test plan must be created first.
ui_tests.title: Negative: RTM generation fails without test plan

steps: Navigate to the application
Locate and interact with the input mentioned in the requirement
Observe the system response and verify it matches the expected outcome
ui_tests.title: Happy Path: does not require additional user input.

ticket_item_coverage.text: The system generates an RTM after a test plan is created.

ticket_item_coverage.non_testable_reason: Item text is unclear or incomplete; needs clarification

ticket_item_coverage.text: Every requirement appears exactly once in the RTM.
The RTM is derived directly from the test plan
does not require additional user input.
If a requirement is not covered by any test, this condition is clearly identified.
RTM generation does not block test plan creation.
The RTM may be returned inline with the test plan response or as a separate artifact.
This capability is required to support ISO audit evidence and future automated test execution.
